members.name: AnimationEvent()
members.description: Creates an AnimationEvent event with the given parameters.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A DOMString representing the name of the type of the AnimationEvent. It is case-sensitive and can be: 'animationstart', 'animationend', or 'animationiteration'.

parameters.name: animationName Optional
parameters.description: A DOMString containing the value of the animation-name CSS property associated with the transition. It defaults to "".

parameters.name: elapsedTime Optional
parameters.description: A float giving the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, when this event fired, excluding any time the animation was paused. For an "animationstart" event, elapsedTime is 0.0 unless there was a negative value for animation-delay, in which case the event will be fired with elapsedTime containing  (-1 * delay). It defaults to 0.0.

parameters.name: pseudoElement Optional
parameters.description: Is a DOMString, starting with "::", containing the name of the pseudo-element the animation runs on. If the animation doesn't run on a pseudo-element but on the element itself, specify an empty string: "". It defaults to "".

members.name: AnimationEvent.animationName
members.description: Is a DOMString containing the value of the animation-name CSS property associated with the transition.

members.name: AnimationEvent.elapsedTime
members.description: Is a float giving the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, when this event fired, excluding any time the animation was paused. For an "animationstart" event, elapsedTime is 0.0 unless there was a negative value for animation-delay, in which case the event will be fired with elapsedTime containing  (-1 * delay).

members.name: AnimationEvent.pseudoElement
members.description: Is a DOMString, starting with '::', containing the name of the pseudo-element the animation runs on. If the animation doesn't run on a pseudo-element but on the element, an empty string: ''.

members.name: AnimationEvent.initAnimationEvent()
members.description: Initializes a AnimationEvent created using the deprecated Document.createEvent("AnimationEvent") method.

parameters.name: typeArg
parameters.description: A DOMString identifying the specific type of animation event that occurred. The following values are allowed: Value Meaning animationstart The animation has started. animationend The animation completed. animationiteration The current iteration just completed.

parameters.name: canBubbleArg
parameters.description: A Boolean flag indicating if the event can bubble (true) or not (false).

parameters.name: cancelableArg
parameters.description: A Boolean flag indicating if the event associated action can be avoided (true) or not (false).

parameters.name: animationNameArg
parameters.description: A DOMString containing the value of the animation-name CSS property associated with the transition.

parameters.name: elapsedTimeArg
parameters.description: A float indicating the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, as of the time the event was fired, excluding any time the animation was paused. For an "animationstart" event, elapsedTime is 0.0 unless there was a negative value for animation-delay, in which case the event will be fired with elapsedTime containing  (-1 * delay).
